questions.user_q: I didn't understand this 'ladder climbing' thing, can you explain me please ?
questions.groundtruth_a: it refers to the continuous evaluation and improvement process of speech-to-text (STT) systems; in the meeting, suggestion was to use tables to be made as simple HTML format as easiest solution, to present the results of the ladder climbing process for easier monitoring and comparison of system performance.
questions.agent_a:
Certainly! The term "ladder climbing" refers to the continuous evaluation and improvement process of speech-to-text (STT) systems. In the context of the meeting, it was mentioned as a topic that requires attention and work.

Ladder climbing involves iteratively training and refining STT models over time to enhance their performance. This is achieved by conducting evaluation campaigns and benchmarking the systems against various metrics. The goal is to identify areas where the system's performance can be improved and make incremental adjustments or updates to achieve better accuracy, efficiency, or other desired qualities.

The ladder climbing process typically involves collecting data, performing evaluations, analyzing the results, and making necessary modifications to the STT models or their underlying components. It aims to gradually climb the metaphorical "ladder" of system performance, taking steps towards achieving higher accuracy and quality in speech recognition.

In the meeting, there was a mention of creating tables, using HTML or other formats, to present the results of the ladder climbing process for easier monitoring and comparison of system performance.

I hope this explanation clarifies the concept of ladder climbing in the context of the meeting. If you have further questions, feel free to ask!

questions.user_q: What is the problem with wearing face masks ?
questions.agent_a: The problem with wearing face masks, as discussed in the meeting, is that it affects the quality of speech recognition. The masks can distort the audio and make it more difficult for the system to accurately recognize speech. This can lead to decreased performance and accuracy in transcription or translation systems.

questions.user_q: What could be done to increase robustness ?
questions.groundtruth_a: Data augmentation: apply frequency filtering to speech training data (to simulate the impact of face masks on high frequencies)
questions.agent_a: To increase the robustness of speech recognition systems in the presence of face masks, the meeting participants discussed a potential solution. They proposed using a brute force approach where the training data is processed through the speech recognition systems, mimicking the distortion caused by the masks. Additionally, a frequency filter could be applied to simulate the impact of face masks on high frequencies. By training the systems on this distorted data, it is expected to improve their performance and robustness when dealing with masked speech.
